introduction.goalText: Our goal is to bring together these passionate individuals, allowing them to work hard based on their own interests and create amazing services.

descriptions.one: The Infoteam is a group of people who are interested in development and have come together to make GIST a better and more enjoyable place to live.
descriptions.two: For some, the fun may come from writing sophisticated code; for others, it might be from creating beautiful services; and for others, it could be from seeing many people use their service.
descriptions.three: Our goal is to bring together these passionate individuals, allowing them to work hard based on their own interests and create amazing services.

passionateMembers.title: Team members who are truly passionate about development

inference.title: Inference: The Infoteam Conference
inference.subtitle: A conference-like event where we share our development experiences
inference.description:
We share how we develop even we are in different project teams.
Through Inference, team members gain new technical inspiration and also gain perspectives from different roles.

toyProjects.title: Toy projects we do just because we want to
toyProjects.subtitle: "Wouldn't it be really fun to make something like this?"

ziggleIntroduction.title: Gathering All the GIST Notices
ziggleIntroduction.webScreenshotAlt: Screenshot of Ziggle Web Main Page
ziggleIntroduction.mobileScreenshotAlt: Screenshot of Ziggle Mobile Main Page

description.title: Ziggle was developed to improve the convenience of GIST campus notices.
description.content1:
Before Ziggle, all GIST campus notices were delivered through KakaoTalk.
As a result, it was difficult to view notices at a glance, and modifying notices was also challenging.
Additionally, users had to be invited to each chat room to receive notices.
description.content2:
To improve this inconvenient user experience, the Infoteam developed the 'Ziggle' notice service in 2023.
Throughout the development process, we incorporated various user feedback and continuously improved the service,
leading to the completion of the current Ziggle.
